abstract: The moves would bring to a close an ambitious, multimillion-dollar bet placed by Kenneth C. Griffin’s hedge fund in the aftermath of the financial crisis.
snippet: The moves would bring to a close an ambitious, multimillion-dollar bet placed by Kenneth C. Griffin’s hedge fund in the aftermath of the financial crisis.
lead_paragraph: The Citadel Investment Group, the $11 billion Chicago-based hedge fund, is in talks to sell its investment bank just three years after its beginning, according to a person briefed on the matter.

headline.main: Citadel Looks to Sell Investment Bank, Shuts Down Equity Research

byline.original: By Azam Ahmed and Andrew Ross Sorkin
